data: RN to have patient complete “Authorization to convey personal information outside of Canada” form
18 gauge or 20 gauge preferred on the same side of planned implant
8 hours prior to Permanent Pacemaker. May have clear fluids until 6 hours prior to procedure. Except for medications
Stop enteral tube feeding 8 hours prior to Permanent Pacemaker in a non-intubated non-ventilated patient
For intubated ventilated inpatients, stop and aspirate the NG-Tube / OG-Tube immediately prior to transfer for Pacemaker Insertion
order rate: 25 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, sublingual, q4h, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
Evaluate the need to discontinue oral anticoagulant
Hold anticoagulation, confirm with provider for when to discontinue

Clinical event: Pacemaker Insertion , Medication(s) to be held: enoxaparin, Instructions: If likely to undergo permanent pacemaker insertion  prior to 12:00 HOLD dose evening prior to procedure and morning of procedure
Clinical event: Pacemaker Insertion, Medication(s) to be held: enoxaparin, Instructions: If likely to undergo permanent pacemaker insertion after 12:00 HOLD dose morning of procedure

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
2,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag
3,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, pre-op, administer over: 60 minute
1,500 mg, IV, pre-op, administer over: 90 minute
